com.pump.job

Class JobRunnable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.job.Job
      • com.pump.job.JobRunnable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancellable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class JobRunnable
extends Job
    This wraps a Runnable inside a Job. When possible it is better to use a robust model (like a Job) that offers the ability to cancel jobs, add listeners, and (through listeners) valuable UI feedback.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.pump.job.Job

        CANCELLED, DEPENDENCIES, DESCRIPTION, FINISHED, NAME, NOTE, PRIORITY, PRIORITY_HIGH, PRIORITY_LOW, PRIORITY_MEDIUM

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void runJob()
      This method is responsible for doing the real work in this Job.

      • Methods inherited from class com.pump.job.Job

        addCancelListener, addDependencies, addDependencies, addDescriptionListener, addFinishListener, addNoteListener, cancel, getDependencies, getDescription, getName, getNote, getPriority, getReplacementId, isCancelled, isFinished, removeCancelListener, removeDescriptionListener, removeFinishListener, run, setDependencies, setDependencies, setDescription, setName, setNote, setPriority, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • runJob

        protected void runJob()
        Description copied from class: Job
        This method is responsible for doing the real work in this Job. This method should constantly poll isCancelled(): if this job has been cancelled, this method should return immediately or throw a UserCancelledException.

        Subclasses are also encouraged to call setDescription() when during this method to give the user cues about what is happening.

        This method is not responsible for interacting with the finish property: that flag will be changed (and listeners notified) when this method returns.

        Specified by:
        runJob in class Job
